column9: Description

Chateau Montelena is a Napa Valley winery most famous for winning the white wine section of the historic "Judgement of Paris" wine competition. Chateau Montelena's Chardonnay was in competition with nine other wines from France and California under blind tasting. All 11 judges awarded their top scores to either the Chardonnays from Chateau Montelena or Chalone Winery, another California wine producer. The castle is quite beautiful as are the grounds leading up to the door. Nice place for children to walk around.

Tamber Bey Winery is located at the Sundance Ranch, a world-class equestrian facility dedicated to training top performance horses. The tasting room is located in the original barn clubhouse, and the barn surrounds the courtyard, where guests can taste wine, mingle with the horses, and enjoy views of Mount St. Helena. There are no vineyards to tour here because their vineyards are over near Yountville. But the grounds are lovely and the atmosphere is relaxed. They offer box lunches for purchase that you can enjoy after the wine tasting.

Lava wine creates wines in small production, usually about 100 to 150 cases per vintage. Their Knights Valley Estate accounts for 50% of the grapes including Petite Sirah, Cabernet Sauvignon, and the Portuguese varietals use in the Dessert wine. Other grapes such as Viognier, Chardonnay, and Grenache are grown in nearby areas better suited to their varietal needs.  They even have picnic tables so you can bring your own food in and enjoy it with your tasting. Children are welcome as well.

Paoletti Estates Winery is located in Calistoga, an ideal location for making great reds. They have 36 acres planted and grow all the grapes necessary for making premium Bordeaux blends and Super Tuscan blends. The tasting area is set off only a few feet from where the production is happening, so you can see everything in progress.  There is a really nice picnic area overlooking a manmade pond and a breathtaking view.

Just down the road from the town of Calistoga, Clos Pegase sits on an amazing piece of ground. It was design by acclaimed architect Michael Graves in 1987 and includes the iconic building, the idyllic grounds, and unique caves. The winery is surrounded by the Applebone Vineyard, one of four of the estate vineyards which together total 450 acres throughout Napa Valley. The estate is peaceful, and the perfect place to spend a casually afternoon.

Jericho Canyon Vineyard was built on a beautiful cattle ranch at the northeast end of Napa Valley outside of Calistoga. Their wines are made in the Bordeaux style. Hand-crafted in small lots, the juice is blended to create a full-bodied, complex wine with well-balanced tannins. The winery is a state of the art redwood structure that leads to a 6,000 square foot cave where the barrels are ageing.

Dutch Henry Winery opened its doors in 1992. In 1999 Dutch Henry Winery was named one of the “top five” wineries to visit while in Napa by the Wall Street Journal. The winery specializes in small lots of Handcrafted wines producing 5,000 cases annually. Bordeaux varietals dominate, but they also produce Cabernet Sauvignon, Syrah, Pinot Noir, Zinfandel, Petite Sirah, Sauvignon Blanc, Argos (Bordeaux Blend) and a dry Rose. They have a big open land with lots of trees and ample picnic tables to dine at.

Frank Family Vineyards are housed in the historic Larkmead winery in Napa Valley. The wines are handcrafted in small quantities and are only sold at the winery, and in a handful of select restaurants and retailers. Their tasting room is located just south of the town of Calistoga where they welcome visitors daily from 10:00 am to 5:00 pm. Groups of six or more require an appointment. You can bring some food buy a bottle of wine and enjoy a picnic outside on their picnic tables.

Bennett Lane Winery is located at the north end of the Napa Valley, where the valley floor meets the edge of the Mayacamas Mountains. The winery consistently crafts superb Cabernet Sauvignon. Bennett Lane Winery is a relaxed and pleasant place to visit, just about two miles north of Calistoga. The winery has a scenic view, is pet-friendly and has an elegantly tasting bar. You can sip wine and have your picnic next to the vineyards. Barrel tastings is by appointment only. Picnic tables are available for use with a tasting or bottle purchase, but you need to bring your own food because none is sold here.

Helena View Johnston Vineyards are located on the east side of Hwy 128 with a beautiful view of Mt. St. Helena about a mile from its base. They are an organic winery producing limited quantities of consistently award-winning complex Bordeaux style reds handcrafted solely from grapes grown in Napa Valley. Picnic facilities and a playground for children are available. Tours and tastings by appointment.

Summers Estate Wines are produced from their vineyard in Knights Valley located northwest of Calistoga, between Mount St. Helena and the Alexander Valley. The first production of Summers Ranch Reserve Merlot was the 1992 vintage. They now also produce the Petite Sirah and have an increased interest in Bordeaux varietals. Purchase a Summers Estate Bottle per couple and enjoy your Picnic Basket on their Patio with a view of Mount St. Helena.

Von Strasser Winery specializes in unique and single-vineyard wines, all grown within Napa Valley’s Diamond Mountain District appellation. As you drive up Diamond Mountain Road, you leave the valley floor behind and enter the beautiful setting of the winery where you can enjoy their world renowned cabs. During your visit you will learn about the winery and be able to taste and purchase unique, single-vineyard bottlings which are rarely available in the market place. Tables are present at the winery for tastings, but they cannot be used for picnics.

Castello di Amorosa is an authentically-styled, 13th century, Tuscan castle and winery. The castle interiors, which include 107 rooms on 8 levels above and below ground, cover approximately 121,000 square feet (11,200 m2).  You can enjoy the castle and winery 364 day a year. With General Admission you can enjoy roaming access on two levels of the winery and a five wine premium or a six wine reserve tasting in the main tasting room. You can also reserve a guided tour followed by the wine tasting. Other options include the cheese and wine or the food and wine pairing. The castle is a fun way for a family with young children to experience Napa as you can explore the castle on our own.

Pelican Ranch Winery is a small, family owned and operated winery specializing in Rhone and Burgundy style wines from the best vineyards in California. Established in 1997, the winery is located a short distance from Monterey Bay which provides the constant, cool, coastal influence that allows for controlled, slow fermentation. Production is limited to 100 cases from each vineyard. Tastings are on the 3rd Saturday of each month from 12:00 – 4:00 pm.

Turdo Vineyards is a family owned and run operation. In 1997, they began the quest and discovered Monterey County’s potential as top-flight winegrowing region. Its vast microclimates and terroir allow for over 40 different grape varieties but it was Pinot Noir they pursued. The 2000 Tudor Santa Lucia Highlands Pinot Noir was the inaugural release from Tudor Wines.

The McIntyre Estate Vineyard lies in the “sweet spot” of Monterey County’s Santa Lucia Highlands AVA, a 12-mile stretch of bench land renowned for producing wines of character and complexity. Originally planted in 1973, the 80-acre site boasts some of the Highlands’ oldest Pinot Noir and Chardonnay vines. The McIntyre Estate Vineyard was among the first properties in the Santa Lucia Highlands to be Sustainability in Practice Certified. The McIntyre Vineyards Tasting Studio is open in the Carmel Crossroads shopping center Tuesday to Saturday 11 am - 7 pm and Sunday 11 am - 6 pm. Monday by appointment only.

Located at the northeastern tip of the Carmel Valley Appellation, the family-owned Holman Ranch resides approximately 12 miles inland from the Pacific Coast. The 100% estate-grown wine varietals are planted on approximately 21 acres of undulating terrain. The climate and terroir of the appellation has played a critical part in the success of their wines. Their tasting room offers a choice of full-bodied Pinot Noirs; light and fruity Pinot Gris; lightly oaked Chardonnay; subtle and crisp Sauvignon Blanc, and their light, crisp, dry Rosé of Pinot Noir. Also available for tasting and purchase is their hand-harvested, cold pressed and bottled, extra virgin olive oil which is produced from the fruits of their 100 Tuscan varietal olive trees.

Nestled in the sunny village of Carmel Valley, California, Cowgirl Winery brings a unique, but authentic experience in wine tasting. An old redwood barn marks the location of the charming tasting room along with chickens that roam the grounds during the day. Cowgirl winery was created to celebrate the past and present culture of Carmel Valley. The tasting room provides an atmosphere where visitors can sit, relax, and appreciate the beauty of wine along with the gorgeous view of the Carmel Valley Hills. There are picnic tables scattered across the yard where you can enjoy your picnic basket or order from their pizza menu they serve outside.

Chouinard Winery is located in Palomares Canyon between Castro Valley and the Livermore wine country on the historic Cook Ranch. Chouinard's winery produces many wines including Malbec, Chardonnay, Barbera Rose, Cabernet, Chenin Blanc and Port. Visit the winery, taste the wine, listen to live music, or celebrate a special event, wedding or party in the vineyard. The winery is very beautiful surrounded by trees and vines with picnic tables scattered next to the grapes. Bring a picnic and taste wine under the 100 year old oak trees.

Picchetti Winery, started in the 1890s, is one of the oldest wineries in California. Located on a historic ranch in the Santa Cruz Mountains and only a short drive from Silicon Valley, Picchetti offers a variety of award winning wines. The Historic Tasting room is open daily from 11a.m. to 5p.m. for wine tasting and picnics. With access to Open Space hikes on nearby trails, you can explore the beautiful terrain while visiting the winery. For families there is plenty of space to have a picnic, grassy areas for children to run and even a little trail for a walk.

Viader is a leading first growth Napa Valley estate established in 1986 and located at 1300ft on the eastern slopes of Howell Mountain. They consistently produce award winning, very limited production red wines and red Bordeaux-style blends. During a visit to this Howell Mountain vineyard and winery estate you can enjoy their wines on the terrace overlooking the vineyards and the beautiful Napa Valley.

Russian River Vineyards are located at the heart of the picturesque and historic Russian River Valley. The vineyards became a model for organic and sustainable agriculture practices and in 1987; Russian River Vineyards was one of the very first in Sonoma County to be certified organic. They have an onsite restaurant and are the only winery-based restaurant in the Russian River Valley, offering a Wine Country dining experience in an historic 1890s farmhouse. Good place to go with kids who can play outside while you wait for your food.

Trione Winery was established in 2005 designed specifically for crafting small lots of wine from their estate grapes grown in the Alexander Valley, Russian River Valley and Sonoma Coast appellations. Trione Winery sits beside a landmark 1908 stone winery. Now an event center, the iconic Old Stone Building is available for private parties and weddings.  Their tasting room is open Thursday through Monday, 10:00 AM to 5:00 PM. You can enjoy there the estate wines, a picnic overlooking Alexander Valley or play a little bocce.

Satori Cellars features wines that are particularly well suited to the hot days and cool evenings of southern Santa Clara Valley, sandwiched between Silicon Valley and the Monterey Peninsula. They are known for their Zinfandel but also enjoy making Cabernet Sauvignon, Petite Sirah, Merlot, Syrah, Chardonnay and Cabernet Franc.   Satori is now open fortasting and sales every weekend from noon to 5pm. Enjoy the new tasting area in front of the winery overlooking the labyrinth. Bring a picnic lunch, buy a bottle of wine and enjoy a picnic at the colorful and fun tables scattered amongst the nearby Zinfandel vines.Children are welcome.

Thomas Kruse Winery is a small family winery producing only 2500 cases of wine annually. It is nestled up against the east foothills of Gilroy along a rural country road. They started in 1998 when they planted 12 acre vineyard of Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Zinfandel and Chardonnay. In 2003 they constructing a new winery building and opened for business. The setting of the winery is friendly and relaxed. You can bring a picnic lunch and enjoy the quiet peaceful surroundings. You can taste wine and take an informative tour.

B.R. Cohn Winery is a midsized boutique family winery in Sonoma Valley, California. Situated just one hour north of San Francisco the vineyards are nestled between the Mayacamas and Sonoma Mountains. Bruce Cohn, manager of the California rock band, The Doobie Brothers, purchased the original area in 1974. He named the property the Olive Hill Estate Vineyards after the grove of 145-year-old olive Picholine Olive trees, from which he continues to make ultra-premium olive oil. The winery is known for their cabernet sauvignon, chardonnay, merlot, pinot noir and award winning gourmet estate olive oils, vinegars and specialty gourmet food products. You can enjoy a tour, tasting and a picnic on the outside tables.

Benziger Family Winery is a family owned winery that for more than thirty years has farmed their ranch on Sonoma Mountain and searched Sonoma County for the most distinctive and expressive vineyards. Benziger Sonoma Mountain Estate transitions from conventional to Biodynamic farming in 1995. Five years later, the Estate was officially certified as a Biodynamic Farm. Now all Benziger wines are certified: Sustainable, Organic, or Biodynamic. Benziger Family Winery is a good place for families as they have a small playground area for children to play near the picnic tables.

Imagery Estate Winery is all about experimenting with new varietals, exploring little known grape regions, and shining the spotlight on wines that are usually swallowed up in big blends. They don’t follow the rules, they take a few risks, and have fun doing so. In a visit to Imagery Estate Winery you will find well-dressed members roaming the grounds sipping wine and playing games with children. There are plenty of picnic tables on the grounds which you can enjoy.

Little Vineyards Family Winery estate includes a premium vineyard with a small production winery and tasting room. In 1996 the family purchased a 25 acre property, restored the property’s century old farmhouse, and planted 17.5 acres of grapes. In 2002 they crafted two award-winning wines from their estate grown fruit: 2002 Zinfandel and 2002 Resonance, a Syrah and Cabernet Sauvignon blend. Little Vineyards Family Winery offers several wine tasting programs. You can also reserve your picnic table for wine tasting with lunch pairing. Or reserve a table on the patio for wine tasting with your own lunch basket.

Loxton Cellars is a working winery in the heart of Sonoma Valley that sources premium fruit from great vineyards. While the focus has been Syrah and to a lesser extent, Zinfandel, small quantities of other wines are made in cases where exceptional fruit has been able to be sourced. They offer visitors wine tasting in their tasting room, or tours with wine tasting in a private sit down tasting, where you are guide through the vineyard and winemaking practices that determine the final outcome of the wines.

Madrone Vineyards Estate was born on the historic site originally planted in 1863, Valley of the Moon Winery, and has been at the foundation of the regions winemaking heritage for over 150 years.  The winery is located 45 miles East of Sacramento on U.S. Highway 50 in the heart of Apple Hill and the California Gold Country. It offers wines crafted from the estate vineyards and from selected blocks from Sonoma County vineyards. Tours of the winery are by appointment only.

Mayo Family Winery was founded in 1993 and has two winemaking facilities in Glen Ellen, California; each fitted and equipped to produce particular types of wines. They offer two different tasting options at Mayo Family Winery. The Premium Tasting contains 6 wines including popular Sonoma Valley varietals such as Chardonnay, Zinfandel, and Cabernet Sauvignon. The Adventure Tasting contains 9 wines of unique varietals ranging from Gewürztraminer to Cabernet Franc!

Wellington Vineyards and Winery is nestled between the towns of Glen Ellen and Kenwood. The winery was purchased in 1986 and is owned by the father and son team of John and Peter Wellington. Now approximately half the grapes they use grow in their vineyard with the remainder purchased from small, unique vineyards. The first Tasting Room opened in 1994 and was cozy with a 15 foot long bar overlooking the vineyard that dates back to 1892. The new Tasting Room looks directly into old vineyards with the Mayacamas Mountains as a backdrop.

Korbel is known for the California Champagnes and their very impressive grounds. Korbel Winery started in 1882 with the production of some 20,000 to 30,000 gallons. In the 1950s the large winery building was expanded, and more vineyards were planted. In 1966, they set out to pioneer the “California-style” champagnes, which displayed more fruit and less yeast than European champagnes. A trip to the Korbel Winery is a 50-minute tour through the historic champagne cellars and history museum, ending with a tasting of their products. Don’t miss the Korbel Gardens that were planted in the 1880s and contain an impressive collection of roses a wide range of perennials, shrubs, redwood, linden, dogwood and flowering plum trees.

Arista Winery was founded in 2002 with a mission to create the most elegant expression of Russian River Valley Pinot Noir. Produced in small lots of several barrels, the wines are deliciously balanced with fruit, tannins, acidity and oak in harmonious proportion. In addition to their wines visitors can enjoy a breathtaking setting of Japanese water gardens, mountain and vineyard vistas, combined with an inviting tasting room, a welcoming environment that encourages picnic lunches and leisurely days spent on the estate.

Christopher Creek Winery is a small, family owned winery with a long history of producing award winning, estate bottled, and hand crafted wines, with annual production around 4,000 cases. Located in Healdsburg, California on 11 rolling acres in the famous Russian River Valley AVA, with another 27 acres planted high on Bradford Mountain in Dry Creek AVA. Christopher Creek has award winning Petite Sirah, Syrah, and Cabernet Franc and now also produce Cabernet Sauvignon, Zinfandel, Pinot Noir, Chardonnay, Viognier, Port and Chocolate Bliss. Visit the rustic tasting room, enjoy a glass of wine or bring a picnic lunch to enjoy on the patio overlooking the rolling vineyards, creek and surrounding vistas.

column2: HKG Estate Wines at Hop Kiln Vineyards
column9: HKG Estate Wines come exclusively from fruit grown on their 250-acre estate located amongst the Russian River Valley’s finest producers. Today they produce 5 different varietals: Pinot Noir, Chardonnay, Pinot Grigio, Rosé of Pinot Noir and Sparkling Rosé of Pinot Noir. The historic Walters Ranch Hop Kiln, stands as a symbol of the care, quality, craftsmanship and longevity that goes into every bottle of HKG Estate Wine. The Hop Kiln also serves as the Tasting Room and Marketplace. They offer daily cheese and wine pairing or historic Hop Kiln tour and tasting. The historic buildings are interesting and the picnic tables overlooking the pond out back are a nice place to take a break and relax.

Nestled in the warmest edge of the Russian River Valley, Merriam Vineyards offers guests the tasting of their California-crafted Bordeaux-style wines in a beautifully appointed tasting room designed with the comfort and warmth of a New England-style home. This new winery, representing an east meets west experience, lies in the hub of three major California appellations, Russian River Valley, Dry Creek Valley, and Alexander Valley, and is the gateway to Healdsburg’s wine country.

Moshin Vineyards and Winery began in 1989 with the purchase of a ten-acre Pinot Noir Vineyard located in the Russian River Valley of Sonoma County, California. Today they specialize in small lot, hand-crafted wines, which include Pinot Noir, Sauvignon Blanc, Chardonnay, Merlot, Petite Sirah and Zinfandel. The tasting room is open daily to the public and tours of the winery can be made by appointment.

Twomey Cellars is a California winery established in 1999 to pursue varietals other than Cabernet Sauvignon. Twomey has two wineries; one in Calistoga in the Napa Valley, and one in Healdsburg in the Russian River Valley, and produces Pinot noir, Merlot and Sauvignon blanc. Twomey’s Sauvignon Blanc is a blend of Sauvignon Blanc grapes from their estate vineyards at their wineries in Napa Valley and Russian River Valley. The Calistoga tasting room echoes the rolling landscape with a sleek, curving tasting bar, and opens on to a sunny courtyard. Twomey Healdsburg features a striking modern design with winding, wraparound patios set into the rolling foothills.

Chateau St. Jean winery is offering guests a true Sonoma experience. Nestled at the center of Chateau St. Jean, "The Chateau" and gardens convey the beauty and grace that the winery and its Sonoma County wines. Created in 2000 the elegant courtyard welcomes visitors to Chateau St. Jean. Inspired by formal estate gardens in Italy and the south of France, it features colorful shrubs and generous groundcover, punctuated by rare palms, citrus and other trees planted in terracotta pots. Two fountains provide soothing sound, with the central fountain situated in front of a 19th century zinc sculpture of Jean, the winery's namesake. You can enjoy the taste of their handcrafted Chardonnay, Cabernet Sauvignon, the Merlot and the Gewurztraminer.

Deerfield Ranch Winery in Kenwood, the heart of Sonoma Valley, is a certified organic producer winery crafting 15,000 cases annually. Deerfield wines are renowned for their colors, rich and wonderfully complex flavors and a long finish. Visiting the winery you will walk through the crush pad, around the fermenting tanks through beautiful Redwood portal doors into the cave. In the Grand Room you can sit comfortably in overstuffed couches and chairs, relax and savor various flights of wine selected from the 20 wines made by Deerfield.

Kenwood Vineyards was established in 1970 in the former Pagani Brothers Winery, a historic cellar dating back to 1906. Thoroughly refurbished and modernized, the facility now boasts more than 125 stainless steel fermenting tanks and large oak uprights, and 17,000 small French and American oak barrels, all devoted to Kenwood Vineyards’ “small lot” style of winemaking. Housed in the original building dating back to 1906, the tasting room is open seven days a week (except major holidays) from 10 a.m. until 4:30 p.m.

For over a century, five generations of the Kunde Family have farmed our 1,850 acre-estate in the heart of Sonoma Valley—a truly remarkable legacy in the modern age of California winemaking. Today, Kunde Family Winery is still family owned and operated with a hands-on team of 4th and 5th generation family members at the helm. They focus on Sauvignon Blanc, Viognier and Chardonnay for the white wines, and Merlot, Syrah, Barbera, Zinfandel and Cabernet Sauvignon for the red wines. They offer three unique tasting experiences at their visitor's center: Main Tasting Room Bar, 202 Lounge and the Kinneybrook Room. The grounds are very beautiful, well taken care of, and there is a nice picnic area outside for those looking to picnic.

Landmark Vineyards is located at the foothills of the Mayacamas Mountains on the corner of Highway 12 and Adobe Canyon Road in Sonoma Valley. The winery, which produces 27,000 cases annually, is housed in a modest, mission-style building set on 11 acres of vineyards. The winery has a pond-side picnic area, as well as a professional bocce court. They offer daily tastings featuring Landmark’s signature wines as well as small-production, winery-only chardonnays and pinot noirs.

Ledson Winery & Vineyards is located in the heart of Sonoma Valley, a short one hour drive north of San Francisco. The 16,000 square foot French Normandy winery is known as "The Castle". In 1997 the family released its first wine, the 1994 Ledson Estate Merlot and in 1999 after two years of reconstruction, the winery opened its doors to the public.  Now the Ledson family specializes in small lots of hand-crafted wines reflecting California's uniquely diverse terroir. Visitors can taste the hand-crafted varietal wines in several beautifully appointed tasting rooms. The back patio area with the fountain and picnic benches is perfect for sharing quality time with family and friends.

St. Anne’s Crossing is the latest addition to the Wilson Artisan Wine Family and is perfectly situated in the heart of Sonoma Valley.  On site, in a scenic vineyard setting, is a lovely winery guest house, with magnificent view of the Mayacamas Mountains that is available for rent. St. Annes crossing shares a property/tasting room with nakedwines.com . They specialize in zinfandels and have a wide selection.

BoaVentura de Caires Winery is dedicated to creating delectable, approachable wines for every household. Their grapes are hand-picked by family members and friends, and they take pride in their wine crafting. Their estate offers spectacular views of rolling hills stretched out among painted skies, creating the perfect setting for growing the most delectable yet unpretentious wines. The winery is a family run winery in a casual setting.  Great place to bring a picnic, taste some wine and even play a little bocce.

Fort Ross Vineyard consists of 32 small mountain vineyard blocks that cling to the sunny coastal mountain ridges overlooking the ocean. Less than a mile from the Pacific Ocean, Fort Ross Vineyard is one of the closest to the ocean in all of California. High on the coastal ridges, the Fort Ross Vineyard produces limited quantities of Estate grown, single vineyard, cool climate Pinot Noir, Chardonnay and Pinotage. Their tasting room is open to the public seven days a week and is overlooks the majestic Pacific Ocean, and is surrounded by forests and meadows.

EmmaLily Vineyards is a small family run winery located in Morgan Hill. Since their first harvest in 2007, they have been making hand crafted, small lot Cabernet Sauvignons, Meritage and Cabernet Franc wines. They bottle around 250 – 400 cases annually, limiting distribution to only wine club members and select retail establishments. The boutique-style winery is open every first and third weekend of the month from 1pm - 5pm.

William Hill Estate Winery carries forward a 30-year philosophy of crafting elegant Napa Valley wines. 140-acres of Estate-owned vineyards surround the contemporary winemaking facility. Their tasting is by appointment only and fees range from$15-25. The winery has breathtaking views which you can enjoy with a picnic lunch.

Located in the heart of the valley floor between Napa and Yountville the Monticello Vineyard is modeled after Thomas Jeffersons's house and the winery is in a basement room. They have a few memorabilia in the tasting room which is pretty small. You can take a two hour tasting tour showing you what it takes to make wine. Tasting is by appointment but you can just buy a bottle and enjoy it on the premises pretending that you’re in the south on a plantation.

Established in 1978, Pine Ridge wines were inspired by the wines of Bordeaux. They produce well-known Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc, Malbec and Petit Verdot. The Estate’s 200-acres span over five renowned Napa Valley appellations – Stags Leap District, Rutherford, Oakville, Carneros and Howell Mountain. The tasting room is little but nice, and each wine was accompanied by the perfect bite.  The bite-size food for the pairing is prepared in-house and resembles the kind of food you expect to get in a fine dining establishment.  The grounds are beautiful and relaxing with a few picnic tables and you are allowed to bring your own food.

Kieu Hoang winery inherited the wine making of the Mondavi family to combine with state-of-the-art technology in fermentation to filtration and the use of yeast in making a wine from both Old World of the best-known Verona, Italy to the New World emerging reputation of Napa Valley, California. The back patio has an incredible scenic view of the grapevines. Seated tables are available for use with a tasting or bottle purchase, but you need to bring your own food because none is sold here.

Bouchaine is the oldest continuously operating winery in the Carneros District. They are a privately-owned boutique winery producing 22,000 cases per year. You can enjoy the fabulous Carneros views, have a tour, and enjoy some wine with lunch (that you can bring) on a reserve table on the deck. Time permits, you can even watch the sun hit the rolling hills rowed with grapes from the gorgeous wood patio.

Clos Du Val winery was founded in 1972. They offer great Pinot noir and Chardonnay.  The grounds of Clos Du Val are beautiful and perfect for a picnic.  Cabanas are reserved for club members, but you can get a picnic table from the front or the side, bring some cheese or a food basket before you get there, purchase a bottle and you got yourself a picnic.

The Bartolucci Family has been producing wine in the Madonna Estate since 1922. They concentrate on organically grown grapes and Estate Bottled wines combining traditional and modern winemaking techniques. The tasting room is small but they have three different picnic areas. You can buy some wine and enjoy lunch outside.

Nestled in the heart of Napa Valley’s Oak Knoll District, Silenus Vintners offers winemakers and vineyard owners the unique opportunity to produce their wines in Silenus Vintners facility. They are currently home to fifteen boutique wineries that collectively produce more than 30 wines all of which are represented in their joint tasting room. The tasting room is nice and the facilities are clean. The grounds are beautiful and they have some picnic tables outside. Open daily by appointment.

Fontanella Family winery processes approximately 200 tons of grapes each year and approximately 3,000 cases annually, consisting of Cabernet Sauvignon, Zinfandel and Chardonnay. The road that takes you to Fontanella is a beautiful display of nature. They feature private tastings paired with carefully crafted bites in their sunny tasting room. Picnic tables are available for use with a tasting or bottle purchase, you might have to share food with the staff if it looks good.

Regusci Winery started in 1932 with the purchased the home ranch. Today, they farm over 2,230 acres of vineyards and have their own winery that produces 6,500 cases of Estate Regusci wines. The patio area is a great place to relax and enjoy the view of the valley. You can also take advantage of their beautiful grounds, and enjoyed a picnic lunch with your wine tasting.

Ahnfeldt wines are only using grapes from their vineyards which are developed, planted, and nurtured by the family. The wine tasting is offered in Uncorked at Oxbow, an historic building in downtown Napa, where guests can enjoy wine, music, food, and education. Activities include barrel tastings, blending seminars, food and wine pairings, and bi-monthly open mic sessions. The tasting room, located in downtown Napa, has picnic tables that are available to customers on a first come first serve basis.

Farella is a small, family-run vineyard and winery estate located inthe heart of the Coombsville-Napa Valley and set against the Vaca Mountains just east of the town of Napa. A total of 1800 cases are now made at Farella Vineyard divided between Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon, Syrah, Sauvignon Blanc and albec. The winery is open for tastings by appointment only most days. The visits are private, and usually hosted by the winemaker. Tastings cost $20 per person (credited to onsite purchases of 6 bottles or more).

Krupp Brothers Winery is a limited production from the Stagecoach Vineyard. They specialize in Bordeaux and Rhone varietals selected from some of the best blocks of their mountainous, rocky vineyards.   They offer visitors a Stagecoach Vineyard excursion, a ride in a four-wheel drive to experience the rustic and wildly beautiful Stagecoach Vineyard. While tasting wines, you can savor a view that spans the Napa Valley and on a clear day, stretches to the San Francisco Bay.

Established in 1969, Cuvaison is a Napa Valley estate vineyard and winery that produces Chardonnay and Pinot Noir grown exclusively on its certified sustainable vineyard in Carneros, Napa Valley. The family also owns Brandlin Vineyard, a leading producer of Cabernet Sauvignon and Zinfandel from Mount Veeder.  You can enjoy both Cuvaison and Brandlin wines on your tasting flight either in the Calistoga Tasting Room North Napa Valley or Carneros Tasting Room South Napa Valley. Both locations offer a beautiful setting, but only the Calistoga location has picnic tables. Picnic tables are available for customers only, so bring your lunch and enjoy yourself.

Reid Family Vineyards was founded in 1992 with the planting of a small Napa Valley vineyard in the foothills of Mt. Veeder. The estate was originally homesteaded in 1880 as a prune ranch and the original barn still remains as a silent reminder of that era. The wine is made using traditional French barrel-to-barrel racking techniques without filtration or fining. They offer a “Bottle a Barrel” program. For a set price per bottle – you can reserve a day and they will oversee the production of one barrel of wine which is then bottled and yours to take home.

Acacia Vineyard sits on a hilltop two miles from San Pablo Bay in the heart of Napa Valley’s Carneros appellation, with views encompassing the entire San Francisco Bay Area. As a premier Napa Valley Winery, Acacia offer an excellent selection of wines accompanied with this beautiful scenery. The wine tasting is done in the standing tasting bar, but you can then relax or have a picnic lunch outside on the picnic benches.

Located on a picturesque stretch of the Silverado Trail, the Black Stallion estate recalls the rustic charm of early California. The estate property is framed by century-old olive trees and landscaped with natural grasses and Mediterranean plants. The winery grounds are surrounded by estate vineyards, planted with three different clones of cabernet sauvignon as well as Malbec. Guests can sample Black Stallion Estate Winery wines in the tasting bar or relax on the terrace aside two trickling fountains. The winery also offers a variety of private event opportunities, including private tours and tastings, lunches and dinners.

Jamieson Ranch Vineyards is the southernmost winery in the Napa Valley.  The estate’s more than 300 acres of gently rolling hills and terraced vineyards benefit from the cooling fog and breezes from the nearby San Pablo Bay, climatic conditions that favor the production of exceptional Pinot Noir and Chardonnay. The vineyard is nice with a rustic, cabin look. There is a large chandelier in the main tasting room that adds a nice touch. It is a ranch so they often walk around with miniature horses that are trained to be therapy horses for special needs children.

Artesa Winery sits high into a hilltop with panoramic views of Napa Valley and San Francisco Bay.  Owned by the Raventos family of Spain, whose winemaking history dates to the mid-sixteenth century, the winery takes its name from the Catalan word for "handcrafted." Today, Artesa focuses on producing small lots of Chardonnay, Pinot Noir, Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon. Their Tasting Room and retail sales area are located at the south end of the salon. Past the larger tasting area, there is an outdoor patio with chairs and tables with a view of the valley where you can enjoy your picnic basket. The landscape is amazing with lots of room for children to run around.

Holman Cellars began as a wine project in a horse barn. As the wines resulted in resounding success, production began to grow and more varietals were vinified. Now Holman Cellars is a family owned micro winery where all wine production is onsite. Visits are by appointment, tasters can sit in the barrel room and sample wines both in bottle and those still in barrel.

Judd's Hill is owned and operated by two generations of the Finkelstein family. The family has been making wine in Napa Valley since the 1970's and continues to produce signature wines. that are fruit-driven, concentrated and just simply delicious. They limit our annual production to less than 3,000 cases. In 2006 construction was completed on their new winery located at the southern end of the Silverado Trail. Judd's Hill has been certified as one of the first Napa Valley Green Wineries by the Napa Valley Vintners. They offer visitors a sit down wine tasting with a spectacular view especially when the sun is setting.

Signorello Estate, located on the Silverado Trail in Napa Valley, produces premium Napa Valley limited production wines including Cabernet Sauvignon and Syrah. Visitors experience a short walking tour of our vineyard and crush pad prior to a seated tasting our wines. They believe that all wine and food is made substantially better and more memorable when carefully matched with each other. Equipped with a full-sized professional kitchen stocked with gourmet meats, artisan cheeses and vegetables fresh from their gardens, they create special dishes to bring out the subtle nuances in the wines. The view on the outdoor patio with the infinity pool overlooking the vineyard is spectacular.

The Hess Collection was founded by Swiss entrepreneur Donald Hess, who first purchased vineyards on Mount Veeder in 1978. . Located in the historic stone winery originally constructed in 1903 the winery first opened to the public in 1989. The winery is best known for its flagship Mount Veeder Cabernet Sauvignon and Chardonnay wines.  It offers visitor fine wine, culinary and free access to Donald Hess’ extensive private contemporary Art Museum. The grounds are beautiful, with a nice courtyard enclosed in brick walls and a koi pond. There are a few tables underneath hanging vines where you can picnic and observe the abstract sculptures.

Bourassa Vineyards is devoted mostly to the five Bordeaux varietals: Cabernet Franc, Cabernet Sauvignon, Malbec, Merlot, and Petit Verdot. Bourassa Vineyards maintains one of Napa’s most distinguished and intimate wine tasting rooms. A luxurious private lounge where you are guided through the range and depth of their winning vintages in a comfortable and inviting atmosphere.

Hopper Creek Winery is located in the southern region of Napa County. Yountville is a popular destinations and home to the French Laundry — widely touted as the best restaurant in the U.S. — and other top restaurants including Bistro Jeanty, Bouchon, and Redd. The six-acre Yountville vineyards produce about 3.5 tons of Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot per acre annually. They purchase additional super-premium grapes from top growers in Sonoma County to round up their portfolio with Chardonnay, Zinfandel, and Petite Syrah. During a visit to the winery you can bring a picnic lunch which you can enjoy at the picnic tables overlooking the vineyards.

The Palmazes bought a forgotten stone winery, a fine old house badly in need of renovation, and acres of land that had once produced fine Napa wines. The little valley had been the site of Cedar Knoll Vineyard and Winery, founded in 1881 by Henry Hagen, one of Napa Valley's pioneer winemakers. Today, the vineyards are burgeoning, the restored Hagen house is a family home again, and the winery has been reinvented. Palmaz Vineyards conducts private tour and tastings by appointment only. The tour consists of a walkthrough of several levels of the cave where they show how the wines are made using gravity-flow winemaking methods.

Turnbull has been rooted in the culture and history of the Napa Valley for more than 35 years. They operate the family business from the original estate winery in Oakville where they produce their enduring Cabernet Sauvignon. The winery contains a world-class gallery that is open to the public and features a rotating collection, twice a year, of historic black and white photography by a plethora of famous artists, including such notables as Berenice Abbott, Ansel Adams, Margaret Bourke White, Dorothea Lange, Herb Ritts and more. You can enjoy a stroll through the pairing garden, relax by the fire pit, or take in the incredible view of the Napa Valley.

Pope Valley Winery is located in a relaxing natural setting. The original farmhouse still graces the property, as well as a blacksmith's workshop, complete with tools of the trade. The tasting room is welcoming offering a number of limited productions, winery only releases. They offer an array of specialty tastings & tours. You can walk around and enjoy the outdoors, hear the sounds of nature, birds, and the wind, drink wine and have a picnic.  The drive up from downtown is easy with beautiful scenery.

Since 2005 Portola winery has been producing hand-crafted vintages in small batches. Sitting at an elevation of 540 feet, the vineyard enjoys the region’s coastal fog, its abundant sun, and it’s cool, dry nights. The wines are made under kosher supervision from grapes that are certified organic are hand farmed.  Most of the 300 case-per-year production is sold in Portola Valley and the surrounding cities. As a small winery they can only host groups of 5 or less. Advance reservations for wine visits are required.  During the summers they host concert series and have great picnic areas.

You can enjoy a glass of wine accompanied by one of the best views in wine country at the Rutherford Hill Winery.  Their picnic table is overlooking the beautiful Napa Valley but their new policy requires that buy 3 bottles for $100 to get access to a picnic table. In the fall there are beautiful colors and big amazing roses! The parking lot sits right on an amazing viewpoint of the area. And not too far away is Rutherford Grill - a great place to grab a bite after you visit. Reservations are required for 8 or more.

Sullivan Vineyards is a boutique Napa Valley winery located in the Rutherford Appellation. It produces mostly Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Bordeaux style blends. They offer a variety of tastings and tasting tours. Reservations are required. They have a beautiful courtyard with nice trees and a little pond nearby. Picnic tables are available and you're free to bring your own food, but a tasting or a bottle purchase is required.

Alpha Omega is located in legendary Rutherford in the heart of Napa Valley and is one of Napa's newest boutique wineries. Surrounded by vineyards and mountains, the beauty of this rustic, farm-style winery is captivating. Their outdoor patio is great to sip your wine while enjoying the afternoon. Wine tasting ranges from $30-$50 depending on your selection. In addition to the friendly staff and ambiance, they are pet friendly, so both children and puppies are welcome.

Sequoia Grove is a family-owned winery founded in 1979 in a 110-year old barn beneath a grove of Sequoia trees in Rutherford, Napa Valley. Their tasting room originally served as a hay barn and once housed the entire original Sequoia Grove Winery operations.  They have a peaceful garden area to walk around and relax in when you're not drinking. Or enjoy a peaceful picnic at one of their picnic tables overlooking the sequoia trees. A reservation and tasting is required to utilize the picnic tables. Contact Vicki at extension 111 to do this. Note each person in the party would be required to do the tasting in order to utilize the picnic tables.

Grgich Hills Estate is a winery located in Rutherford, California in the heart of the Napa Valley. The winery changed its name in 2006 when it first began producing only "estate grown" wines made from grapes grown exclusively in vineyards owned by the winery. This family-friendly winery welcomes walk-in visitors to their main tasting room where you are surrounded by oak barrels and the seductive aromas of wine. You can also enjoy a walking tour and tasting where you will discover the rich history of Grgich Hills Estate or relax and enjoy a private tasting overlooking the Rutherford.

St. Supéry Estate Vineyards & Winery is a family owned sustainably farmed winery in the famous Rutherford appellation. St. Supéry specializes in estate grown Sauvignon Blanc, Cabernet Sauvignon and Bordeaux varietal blends, with more than 500 acres of Napa Green certified vineyards. The Skalli family has planted their first vineyard in 1920 and carry this tradition on through the generations with their ownership of St. Supéry Estate today. The winery and art gallery are open daily 10 a. m. - 5 p.m. for tastings, tours, Interactive Wine Experiences and special events.

Honig Winery is a family run winery whose first commercial vintage dates to 1984. Patriarch Louis first purchased 68 acres 1964 and planted two varietals, Cabernet Sauvignon and Sauvignon Blanc. For a number of years the grapes from this property were sold to other area vintners. Their first vintage of Sauvignon blanc was made in 1981. Today their wines are sold in all 50 states as well as Asia, Europe, the Caribbean. The outside seating for the tasting is very welcoming and relaxed and you can bring a picnic lunch and your kids.

Bottle Jack is a small, family-run operation.  Family members help driving harvest trucks, crushing and fermenting the juice, working the bottling line and pouring wines for customers. You can taste the current releases in their winery among the barrels with an informal atmosphere on the 3rd Saturday of each month, from 12:00 – 4:00 pm. The winery is located 3 miles North Downtown Santa Cruz and features beautiful bay, and mountain views.

Founded in 1977, Matanzas Creek Winery was one of the Sonoma County pioneer wineries focused on created handcrafted premium quality wine. Located in the northwest corner of Sonoma Valley, Matanzas Creek's home is the Bennett Valley on the site of a former dairy. The scenic grounds showcase beautiful sculptures and a fragrant lavender garden with more than 4,500 plants. You can stroll the grounds, play a game of bocci or enjoy the picnic areas. Fee is waived with purchase from your tasting or by signing up to be a member of our wine club.

Balletto Vineyards is committed to growing and producing distinct, high quality wine from their Estate Vineyards located throughout Sonoma County’s famed Russian River Valley. They select 10% from many different clones and soil types to make their wine and sell the remaining 90% of their grapes to other wineries. They specialize in cool-climate Pinot Noir, Pinot Gris, Zinfandel, Chardonnay & others. Their property is simple but lovely to picnic in.

Nestled in Sonoma County, D’Argenzio Winery is a boutique winery owned and operated by three generations of Italian Americans working together. The Santa Rosa’s urban boutique winery specializes in offering a selection of wines from Sonoma County’s most prestigious appellations as well as a unique collection of Italian Varietals. Each wine produced is a small lot, with less than 300 cases of each produced. You can visit their Sonoma County winery in Northern California or their Los Angeles Enoteca Wine Tasting Room in Southern California.

HANNA Winery was founded in 1985 and is most commonly known for its Russian River Valley Sauvignon Blanc and Chardonnay, as well as its Alexander Valley Cabernet Sauvignon. HANNA Winery also produces other varietals such as Zinfandel from the steeply-terraced hillsides of Bismark Mountain Vineyard. Their Mediterranean-style tasting room sits atop a knoll overlooking the Alexander Valley and the “Red Ranch” vineyard, home to their flagship Cabernet and Merlot. The building’s wrap-around veranda is the perfect place to enjoy the stunning view while sipping your wine. You can also have a picnic, right outside the winery on their picnic tables.

Established in 2000 Inman Family Wines are produced in small lots exclusively with wine grapes from the Russian River Valley. The estate vineyard, Olivet Grange is organically farmed. They employ winemaking techniques that preserve nuance and highlight the unique qualities of the source vineyards.  You can visit the winery and tasting room at the Olivet Grange Vineyard. Located at the junction of Olivet and Piner Road, the tasting room is open Thursday through Monday from 11am-4pm. A private tasting and vineyard tour with winemaker and owner Kathleen Inman is available by appointment.

The aim of Lost Canyon Winery is to craft wines that exemplify each of the distinct attributes of their different vineyards. Each of the carefully selected single-vineyards have a distinctive location and a personality of their own. Each vineyard's character guides the Lost Canyon wine style of elegantly lush and vibrant fruit flavors with a careful balance of natural acids and delicate tannins. You can try the wines at their Tasting Room; Located at 123 4th St. in downtown Santa Rosa, CA.

The Mountain Winery, formerly the Paul Masson Mountain Winery, is a winery in Saratoga, California, USA. It was founded by Paul Masson, a pioneer of the California wine industry. The winery became famous for its slogan, voiced by Orson Welles in television commercials, "We will sell no wine before its time." The Winery provides an incomparable setting for a wide variety of events, including weddings, corporate meetings, dinner parties, concerts, and holiday parties. Their concerts featured famous performers such as Ella Fitzgerald, Tony Bennett, Aimee Mann, Ringo Starr, Stevie Wonder, Ray Charles, The Beach Boys, and Carlos Santana.

The Cooper-Garrod Estate Vineyards is a family owned and operated estate winery. Located on hillsides above Saratoga, the vines capitalize on the sunny days, moderate nights, and long growing season of the Santa Cruz Mountains.  Their historic tasting room, the Fruit House, is open daily except for special holiday. It’s a great place for the entire family. There are several picnic tables so you can drink wine and enjoy some food while overlooking their estate. There is a mini table located inside for children to sit at. They also have a stable where kids can go for a horseback ride.

Since the winery’s inception, Dutton Estate wine production was in a quaint farm building at the winery’s property located on one of their vineyards in the Russian River Valley. In spring of 2006, a new winery building was constructed alongside the old barn and is now home for Dutton Estate wines as well as a small number of high-end wine producers.  Varietals of sauvignon blanc, chardonnay, pinot noir and syrah are currently being produced.

Patz & Hall was founded in 1988 and today is one of California’s most highly regarded wineries, with a celebrated portfolio of single-vineyard Chardonnay and Pinot Noir wines. The Sonoma House at Patz & Hall is located just north of the Eighth Street wineries, within biking distance of Sonoma Square and the shops of downtown Sonoma. It offers a wine tasting experience where you can relax as you look out over the estate vineyards tucked along the edge of the Mayacamas Mountains while enjoying the acclaimed Chardonnays and Pinot Noirs.

The name Anaba originates from cool, upward-flowing anabatic winds that soar and swirl through its sustainably-farmed Carneros Estate vineyards. Anaba's Rhône-style wines are artistic blends, inspired by the rugged earthiness of France's Rhône Valley, while their Chardonnays and Pinot Noirs reflect the elegance and grace of the gently sloping vineyards found in Burgundy.The Anaba tasting room is a charming, recently-restored 100 year-old farmhouse situated amongst the estate vineyards.  During a visit you can enjoy tasting inside at the tasting bar or seated on the patio overlooking the vineyards. You can also bringing your picnic and enjoy the outside patio with tables.

Bartholomew Park Winery was founded in 1994 and is nestled on a historic, organically-farmed estate just a few blocks east of Sonoma's plaza.  The unique setting of this vineyard, tucked up against Arroyo Seco, enjoys, warm temperatures, constant breezes and excellent drainage typical of higher elevation sites. They produce hand-craft boutique quantities of single-vineyard wines offered exclusively through their tasting room and website. They offer a unique food and wine pairing experience in an outdoor setting overlooking the vineyards. You can also bring a picnic basket and enjoy the beautiful grounds and their picnic tables surrounded by nature.

Founded in 1857, Buena Vista is located in Sonoma and is the oldest commercial winery in California. The original winery is now a California Historic Landmark, and home to the winery, tasting room, and visitor’s center.  Jjust 5 minutes from Sonoma’s famous plaza square, Buena Vista Winery’s Historic Press House is open for tasting year-round. They offer a wide selection of new releases, as well as a library of older wines for your enjoyment. A designated Historic Landmark, the shaded picnic grounds are a nice spot where child and dog are also welcome.

Cline Cellars is a family-owned vineyard and winery, Situated on a historic 350-acre estate, in the Carneros region of Sonoma County, California and that specializes in Zinfandels and French Rhône-style wines.  The Cline property was originally intended as the site of the final California Mission in 1820. The Clines have constructed a museum that displays meticulously hand-crafted models of all 21 missions as well as two stained glass panels originating in 15th Century Spain. The grounds of the estate contain six spring-fed ponds home to turtles and the occasional heron. A visit to Cline Cellars and the sister properties across the street—Jacuzzi Family Vineyards and The Olive Press—will enchant you with the flavors, fragrance and friendliness of Sonoma County. Cline is family friendly and children can play in the grass area, feed the ducks & learn a little about California history at the museum.

Gundlach Bundschu is California's oldest continuously family-owned winery, and is the second oldest winery after Buena Vista Winery. It is still owned and operated by the founder's heirs and today led by the sixth generation. The winery's 320-acre estate vineyard is located within the Sonoma Valley AVA of Sonoma County, at the crossroads of the Sonoma Valley, Los Carneros AVA and Napa Valley AVA, along the Mayacamas Mountains. Today, they focus on making small lots of ultra-premium wines from this distinctive and historic property. The grounds are beautiful, great place to bring a picnic and relax by the water at one of the tables.

The Jacuzzi Family Vineyards started in 1921 with the purchase of a 161-acre farm in Contra Costa County in Northern California. In 1936 the family applied for a license to make wine for home consumption. Limited to 200 gallons (approximately 84 cases) the vineyard was planted to Zinfandel, Carignane and Mourvedre and thjey sold grapes for $30-$35 a ton. In a visit to the Jacuzzi Family Vineyards you can enjoy a tasting of both wine and olive oil. The tour starts with The Olive Press; guests are escorted through the press room and into the piazza for a tasting of four featured oils. Then guests enjoy Jacuzzi’s Italian wines. The grounds in the back courtyard are perfect for picnics overlooking Sonoma Valley and the vineyards.

Larson Family Winery is a fun, family friendly winery located in the heart of the Carneros region of Sonoma. The winery sits on 70 acres and lends itself to some of the best views in Sonoma County. Enjoy a unique, one of a kind wine country experience that was once home to the Sonoma Rodeo. The property is beautiful and has a gorgeous picnic space with lots of flowers, a small lake and the green mountains in the backdrop.

Nestled in the southern foothills of the Sonoma, the vineyards of Nicholson Ranch are planted in one of the world's most prized grape-growing regions. The Ranch enjoys a combination of soils, sloping hills and climate that is ideal for producing premium grapes for handcrafted Chardonnay, Pinot Noir, Merlot and Syrah. Nicholson Ranch is a casual and friendly place to taste fine wines and enjoy sweeping wine country views. You can sit by the lakeside, in the Fountain Courtyard, or at the tasting bar. Very family friendly where kids can play outside with the winery dog-pepper.

Ravenwood's "No Wimpy Wines" credo says it all - embraced the bold, abhor the bland. From out flock of Single Vineyard Designate wines, as unique as the individual vineyards they're from and the people who farm them, to the Country Series wines that capture the spirit of California's best growing regions and the popular Vintners Blend bottling sourced from vineyards throughout California, we strive to put what we pick from the fields right into the bottle. Unadulterated, unapologetic, unfussy, unwimpy.

In 1996 Reynaldo Robledo, who left his home state of Michoacan, Mexico to work in Napa Valley formed his own vineyard management business, Robledo Vineyard Management, LLC.  The family then purchased fourteen vineyards, totaling approximately 350 acres, in Sonoma, Napa and Lake Counties. The Robledo family opened the first winery in 2003.  Although they still sell most of their fruit to other wineries, they now produce an impressive portfolio of premium wines. The Robledo Family Winery tasting room is off hwy 116 on Bonness Road in Sonoma Valley  approximately 10 minutes South of the beautiful Historic Sonoma Plaza and 45 North of San Francisco.

Founded in 1980 Schug Carneros Estate Winery is situated on a 50-acre site in the Carneros Appellation, south-west of the town of Sonoma. Vineyards of Pinot Noir and Chardonnay surround the winery, while other grapes are bought in from highly respected and experienced growers. The Schug Carneros Estate is open to the public daily from 10am to 5pm. The drive up from Bonneau Road will take you through the vineyards and rose borders to where the winery building is tucked into a hillside containing underground barrel caves. Behind the German style post-and-beam building, there is a vista point with a 360º view of the surrounding area and the opportunity to see as far as Mount Diablo on a clear day.

Sebastiani’s first century in Sonoma winemaking began in 1904. In 1985 the company went through a transition and became one of Sonoma County’s premier quality wine producers. The Sebastiani tasting room and hospitality center went through a multi-million dollar remodel which was completed in 2001 and now offers unique cultural and historic programs for visitors. In addition, the production facility underwent major renovation with an emphasis on small-lot artisan winemaking. Bill Foley purchased Sebastiani in 2008. Today, the winery emphasises single-vineyard and sub-appellation wines.

The St. Clement house was built in 1878 and over the years the property was owned by a number of colorful characters who made wine under the house. It is a small boutique winery in the heart of Napa Valley. They offer tastings in the Victorian house on a walk-in basis, or you can make reservation for a tour of the property and its unique history, or a private tasting in the Wine Vault.

Experience the beautiful Franciscan Estate Winery in St. Helena in Napa Valley.  Enjoy tasting at the Napa valley winery's visitor center where current releases of classic and reserve Franciscan wines are available. Take part in the Taste Exploration Series, take a vineyard tour or enjoy a glass or a bottle with friends on our shaded courtyard. The picnic tables in the courtyard are available to wine club members only.

Cairdean Estate, Napa Valley's Wine & Food Village, is a one-of-a-kind wine and food destination offering multiple wine tasting experiences, spectacular dining and shopping all set against the vista of Napa Valley's Vaca Mountains. The Estate is located just 2 miles north of downtown St. Helena right on Highway 29. Guests may sample award-winning wines in the Cairdean Vineyards Tasting Room, or enjoy The Farmer & The Fox recipient of a 2015 Michelin Big Gourmand Award that serves dinner nightly from 5pm to 10pm. Butterscots Bakery, Deli & Culinary Market serves artisanal sandwiches, salads, pastas, desserts, and baked goods, making for an excellent St. Helena breakfast or lunch spot. Picnic tables are available for use to customers having a wine tasting or purchasing from the Butterscots Bakery. Unfortunately no outside food or glasswear is allowed.

Louis M. Martini has been home to world-class Cabernet Sauvignon for more than 80 years. Located in the heart of the Napa Valley their daily offerings include curated tasting flights. They have a lovely patio and you can bring your own food and enjoy the patio as long as you either get table bottle service or do a tasting.  The little ones can enjoy exploring that back garden area with the beautiful fruit trees.

V. Sattui Winery is a winery and retail store located in St. Helena, in the Napa Valley region of California. The winery is known for their large retail store and picnic area, which has events such as an annual Harvest Ball. Their wines have received numerous awards and reviews, and are sold exclusively at the winery or online. No visit to V. Sattui Winery is complete without spending some quality time outdoors enjoying the picnic grounds. However outside food and wine are not allowed on the property.

The Charles Krug Winery offers an eclectic portfolio of wine for tastings. The renovated winery kept the exterior elegant historic building. The inside includes a large tasting room/bar/lounge area, a sectioned-off redwood barrel room (where they offer barrel tastings for an extra fee), and a second-floor loft dedicated to the winery's history. The winery is located across the street from the Culinary Institute of America and they stock Culinary Institute chocolate truffles to sample when tasting port.

Rutherford Ranch Winery is a family-owned and managed winery that for three generations has been committed to earth-friendly wine growing. The winery is located on Napa Valley's scenic Silverado Trail within the Rutherford District. Of Napa's 16 designated AVA's (American Viticultural Area), the district is renowned for producing unsurpassed Cabernet Sauvignon along with other premium varietal grapes. Visitors are welcomed 7 days a week and can relax and stroll in estate's 100 year-old olive grove. They have ample outside seating, and they encourage you to drink a bottle or a glass outside, and have a  picnic if you like. The wine and chocolate pairing is delicious.

The Somerston property is 1628 acres of natural beauty, with over 200 acres of sustainably farmed vineyards, winery, and a developing ranch and farm. The property has several spring fed lakes, natural soda springs, and several acres dedicated to farming of fruit trees, vegetables, herbs, and gardens. The wine tasting room in Yountville features a comfortable setting where you can try current release wines. A private tasting of the Somerston Estate wines is also available by appointment. They offer artisan cheese plates and exquisite chocolates to enhance the tasting experience. Picnic tables are available at the winery, but a tour is required in order to use them.

HALL Wines winery has two locations in St. Helena and Rutherford. HALL St. Helena is a vibrant, 33-acre property off Highway 29 in the charming town of St. Helena. Guests have a choice of winery tours and tastings for the novice wine drinker to the expert cab collector. The site is 150 year old and offers wine, art, history, architecture, technology a lush landscaping and a Great Lawn for relaxing and unwinding. The artwork around the grounds is interesting and unique. The tasting room upstairs has a lovely view of the vineyard and a great deck with seating area where you can have a picnic.

Whitehall Lane Winery is a small, family owned winery in Napa Valley's historic Rutherford appellation operated by the Leonardini Family. In 2013, they celebrated their 20th year of Family Winemaking in the Napa Valley. The staff is very knowledgably and the tours are informative. They are very accommodating to whole families including infant in strollers or children.

Charbay Distillery & Winery is one of the most unique & interesting places to visit in Wine Country. The tasting room in the Spring Mountain District houses a collection of small-lot wines, spirits and ports in a country setting. You can learn about the distillery process, and see how the Napa Valley whiskey, brandy, vodka or green-tea aperitifs are produced. It's a pretty small place and the vineyard is pretty high up and located on swirly roads so call ahead so they know you're coming.

Nichelini Family Winery is one of the pioneers of Napa Valley’s modern wine industry. In 1895 they constructed a stone winery with a seven-bedroom house above it. The winery, original Roman wine press and house still stand today and have remained in the family’s hands for more than 120 years. You can reach the winery after a stunning drive into the hills east of Oakville. No appointment necessary and tasting fee are $15 which is waived with purchase. Bring your picnic to complement the tasting or simply get a bottle and enjoy your picnic on the beautiful grounds.

Kuleto Estate Winery is located on the eastern edge of the Napa Valley overlooking Lake Hennessey and the town of Rutherford. It features 82 individual vineyard blocks and produces a small portfolio of estate grown wines. The winery is open daily by appointment only with tours offeredat 10:30am, 11:45am, 1:00pm, and 2:30pm. Tours and tastings are at $40 per person and are independent of wine purchased. Pack a lunch if you go as they have a very nice area where you can picnic before or after your tour.

David Fulton built the first commercial stone wine cellar within the town limits of St. Helena in 1861. The David Fulton Winery is located just a short walk east from downtown St. Helena, on Fulton Lane. The winery was recently restored and tucked beneath three large valleys. A replica of the old Fulton stone wine cellar is the lowest level of the three story building that sits at the northwest edge of the family vineyard. A few yards to the west are two large sentinel palm trees, a restored tank house and David Fulton’s original, historic farmhouse.  The small family owned and operated vineyard specializes in Petite Sirah which you can enjoy on their deck with a picnic basket or other treats.

Rutherford Grove Winery and Vineyards is a small, family owned winery located in the historic Rutherford appellation of the Napa Valley.  It opened its doors in 1994. They offer a tasting menu of all their wines, plus limited production bottlings and library wines that can only be found at the winery. Customers of the tasting room are welcome to use the picnic grounds and bocce ball court. The tasting room is open daily 10am to 4:30pm excluding major holidays. Reservations are needed for groups of 5 or more. Picnic tables are available for use with the purchase of a bottle or a tasting.

Amizetta Estate Vineyard & Winery is located on a steep and rocky 40 acre parcel with southern facing slopes at the tail end of Howell Mountain in the Conn Valley region of Napa Valley. It offers a beauty view of Lake Hennessey and the Napa Valley. All tastings at Amizetta Vineyards are private. The family personally tours each visitor through the winery and wine caves tasting aged wines from the barrel and finished bottled wines in the Tasting Room. The Picnic area overlooking the vineyards and Lake Hennessey are provided for visitors.  Tours are $50.00 per/person, tasting fee is waived with a 6 bottle purchase.

column9: Corison Winery is open daily from 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. by appointment. A visit to the winery offers a unique glimpse inside a small, family-owned working winery.  The tasting is done in a large barn-like building that is full of barrels. There is a single picnic table in the back that overlooks a gorgeous vineyard. The picnic table is for wine club members only and requires advanced reservations to use.

Keenan winery is 180 acres in the Spring Mountain District of the Napa Valley at an elevation of 1700 feet. Originally famous for their Chardonnay today Keenan Winery produces four superb and distinctive wines exclusively from grapes grown our Spring Mountain Estate: Chardonnay, Cabernet Sauvignon Reserve, Cabernet Franc and a Merlot Reserve from the Mailbox Vineyard. The grounds are casual and there are a few picnic tables with great views of the vineyards where you can enjoy a picnic lunch. Picnic tables are for winery customers only and are available on a first come first serve basis.

Anderson’s Conn Valley Vineyards in Napa is just a short drive from downtown St. Helena, and a charming timepiece of a traditional Napa winery. Since 1983 Conn Valley Vineyards has been family owned and operated by the Anderson's, and since their first release in 1987, Conn Valley Vineyards has been dedicated to producing world class wines. The 40 acre Estate is located just south of Howell Mountain in Conn Valley. You can try current releases and library wines in their Barrel Caves.

Tres Sabores is a small, family-owned ranch located on the western Rutherford Benchland of California’s Napa Valley, where they grow organically certified Zinfandel, Cabernet, Petite Syrah and Petit Verdot grapes, olives, Meyer lemons and exotic pomegranate cultivars.  Their single-vineyard wines include Tres Sabores estate Zinfandel, Cabernet Sauvignon and Sauvignon Blanc from the Farina Vineyard of Sonoma Mountain. They have plenty space for a lunch picnic in a nicely shaded area overlooking the beautiful grape vines. Children are welcome.

Schweiger is a small family-operated vineyard and winery located on top of Spring Mountain, just west of St. Helena, in the heart of the Napa Valley. Since 1979 they have been farming their property, growing ultra-premium Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Chardonnay. In 1994, they began crafting their own sustainable small production wines including estate grown Cabernet Sauvignon, Chardonnay, Merlot, Malbec, Cabernet Franc and Petite Sirah. During a visit to the winery you can enjoy incredible views while savoring artisan style wines in the rustic tasting room or enjoy your packed lunch at the nice picnic area. When booking your tasting, mention you want to utilize one of the picnic tables to reserve them in advance. There are 3 tables for 4 people and 2 tables for 2 available.

Tudal Winery was founded in 1974 on ten acres within the shadow of the Mayacamas Mountains with the Napa River running alongside the property. The first commercial release of the Estate Cabernet Sauvignon was seen in 1979. They have since added a variety of wonderful blends which include the award winning Tractor Shed Red, and the 30th anniversary Legacy Lot 2009 Cabernet Sauvignon. They have a beautiful yard where you can picnic at and even host parties.

Sutter Home is an award-winning winery in St. Helena in the Napa Valley.  With its creation of White Zinfandel in the early 1970s and the introduction of high-quality, affordably priced varietal wines during the 1980s and '90s, Sutter Home in the Napa Valley became a household name and the second largest, independent family-run winery in the U.S.Sutter Home started its Sutter Home for Hope program more than eight years ago and, working closely with City of Hope, has raised hundreds of thousands of dollars for research, treatment, and education. Through the cohesive efforts of one dedicated American family, Sutter Home Family Vineyards has made lasting contributions to the quality of the nation’s wine, food, and health.

Raymond Vineyards, founded in 1970, is one of the Napa Valley's pioneers and great estates. Arriving to Napa in 1933, the Raymond family became deeply connected to the valley's winemaking origins. In 1970, they established a 90-acre estate in Rutherford that now comprises 300 acres in Rutherford, St. Helena and Jameson Canyon. Raymond Vineyards winery and tasting room is open year-round every day for tastings and tours from 10:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m. They are also available during day or evening hours for private lunches, dinners, parties or business meetings.

Robert Mondavi first established his winery in 1966 in Oakville, California that is now renowned for their Cabernet Sauvignon and the Sauvignon Blanc grapes, from which he produces his signature wine, Fumé Blanc. Mr. Mondavi believed that the path to a gracious lifestyle leads through the appreciation of wine, food, and art and he combines all three in a tour of his winery.Visitors can chose a number of tours like, for example, a one hour walking vinery tour that concludes with a one and a half hour three course wine pairing lunch. The winery accommodates childrenin their tours.

Beringer winery started with the purchased 215 acres of land in 1875, and became one of the first wineries in Napa Valley. The winery pursues a balance between modern technology and time-tested winemaking traditions, resulting in wines of global recognition. They offer wine tasting tours daily at 10:30 a.m., 1:00 p.m., and 3:30 p.m. During the tour you learn about the Napa Valley, Beringer Family history and the winemaking process. You also visit the demonstration vineyard to learn some viticulture basics, and then explore the Old Winery and historic tunnels. From there you will proceed to the Rhine House for a sit-down hosted tasting. They also offer the “Intro to Beringer" tour is ideal which is free for kids and quite short, but focused on history and not wine.

Founded in 1973 Conn Creek is a small winery located on the scenic Silverado Trail in the heart of Napa the Silverado Trail meets Conn Creek Road, an extension of the Rutherford Crossroad. They are best known for Bordeaux-styled wines including Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Sauvignon Blanc. The original Mediterranean-style winery has undergone several renovations, including an expanded barrel room and the addition of a demonstration vineyard garden. In addition to wine tasting visitors are offered a Barrel Blending Experience were guests learn about, taste, and blend wines from the many distinctive regions that make up Napa Valley.

Casa Nuestra Winery & Vineyards was established in Napa Valley’s historic St. Helena district in 1979. They  produced about 2,000 cases of handmade wine annually including Meritage, Merlot, Cabernet Franc, Cabernet Sauvignon, dry Chenin Blanc, White Riesling, Petite Sirah, Charbono, French Colombard, Rosado, a dry rose and two proprietary red wines called Tinto Classico and Tinto St. Helena – unique wines made from rare, one-of-a-kind ” field blend” vineyards. Their estate is laid back and children can enjoy the grounds - goats, dogs, and the funky and relaxing picnic space.

The Seavey Vineyard property was first settled in the early 1870s when Swiss immigrant Charles Volper acquired a 143-acre parcel along a lovely stream that flowed down the center of Conn Valley, an eastern spur of Napa Valley. In 1989, the Seaveys renovated the original 1881 stone dairy barn as their winery and tasting room, and in 1990 made their inaugural vintages of Cabernet Sauvignon and Chardonnay under the Seavey Vineyard label, adding Merlot in 1994 and their second Cabernet label, Caravina, in 1999.

Nella Terra Cellars Boutique Winery and Event Center started in 2013. Nella Terra’s hillside vineyard is nestled atop the Sunol grade on the outskirts of Livermore Valley.They grow two varietals that are well suited to the cooler days of Sunol; Pinot Noir and Viognier.  Their beautiful grounds offer a nice backdrop and intimate experience for special event. The green hills in the winter and flourishing vines in the summer are perfect for weddings, corporate events, family picnics, live music and weekend tastings year-round.
